name: a fickle light #7
description:
"About 30%–40% of insects that approach street lamps die soon thereafter". 
Some nocturnal insects navigate by sighting on a distant light source and fly at a constant angle to it. When the moon is that source, the insects 'transverse orientation' is constant, but with closer sources such as street lights can disorient it. 
From a series - a fickle light - that focuses on artificial light and its effect on urban fauna and flora.
